The LEZ covers most of Greater London and operates 24-hours-a-day, every day of the year. It was introduced in 2008 to encourage the most polluting heavy diesel vehicles driving in the Capital to become cleaner.
If you want to drive a lorry, bus, coach, or other specialist heavy diesel vehicle in the LEZ without paying a daily charge, it needs to meet certain emissions standards.

Larger vans, minibuses and other specialist diesel vehicles are also affected by the LEZ. If you own this type of vehicle, it must meet certain emissions standards to be driven within the LEZ without paying a daily charge.
It doesn't matter whether your vehicle is used for commercial or private purposes - it still needs to meet the standards.
Read the London Road User Charging privacy notice .
Be careful not to mix up the letters 'I' and 'O' with the numbers '1' and '0'.
Make sure you enter the country of registration accurately. If incorrect information is provided, a Penalty Charge Notice may be issued.

According to our records your vehicle is subject to the £200 daily LEZ charge. This could be because your vehicle's details are registered with us and it doesn't meet the required Low Emission Zone standards.

If we don't recognise your vehicle details then the £200 daily LEZ charge automatically applies. (For example, if your vehicle is registered outside the United Kingdom.) If you believe your vehicle does meet the required standards, you will need to register it with us .
Until your vehicle is successfully registered you will need to pay the £200 daily LEZ charge every time you drive it within the zone.

Select the date that this vehicle will be driven in the LEZ. The charge covers a 24-hour period from midnight to midnight, so if you are travelling in the zone on the evening of day1 and leaving on the morning of day2 you will need to pay the charge for both days.
You cannot pay the charge for this date as it is too far in the past. You can only pay from the last working day, today or a day in the future.
For example, if today is Wednesday, you can pay the LEZ charge for Tuesday or any date from today up to 65 working days in the future.
However if today is Monday, you can pay the LEZ charge for Friday, Saturday or Sunday, or any date from today up to 65 working days in the future.

If your vehicle is being charged the £200 daily LEZ charge there may be a number of reasons for this. The higher charge rate will apply if your vehicle is registered with us, does not meet the required emissions standards and is a lorry, bus or coach.

The £200 daily LEZ charge automatically applies if we don’t recognise your vehicle details (for example if your vehicle is registered outside the United Kingdom). If you believe your vehicle does meet the required standards, you will need to register it with us .
If your vehicle is being charged the £100 daily LEZ charge it is because it does not meet the emissions standards and is registered with us as a larger van or minibus.

If your vehicle meets the required emissions standards you will pay the standard Congestion Charge. If it does not meet the standards then your charge will include an additional T – Charge value. If your vehicle is exempt or discounted from the Congestion Charge and does not meet the Emissions standards then you may still need to pay the T – Charge. The charge you need to pay will be automatically calculated and displayed. For further information go to tfl.gov.uk/driving/t-charge
